clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Intervention Study of Stress Reduction in Corporate Health Management
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Intervention Study of Stress Reduction in Corporate Health Management: Evaluation of the Effects of Heart Rate Variability (HRV) Biofeedback Training, Mindfulness Based Intervention (MBI) and Mindfulness Based HRV-biofeedback

lead_sponsor.agency: ARCIM Institute Academic Research in Complementary and Integrative Medicine

clinical_study.source: ARCIM Institute Academic Research in Complementary and Integrative Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is the evaluation of the effects (psychological and physiological) of an hrv-biofeedback training, a mindfulness training and a combination of both training methods for stress reduction.

primary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of stress perception after training
primary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
primary_outcome.description: We assessed psychological parameters of stress perception with the following questionnaire: TICS ("Trierer Inventar zum chronischen Stress"; Schulz, Schlotz & Becker, 2004). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of stress coping (behavioral skills) after training
primary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
primary_outcome.description: We assessed psychological parameters of stress coping with the following questionnaire: SVF 120 ("Stressverarbeitungsfragebogen; Janke & Erdmann, 1997). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of stress coping (behavior pattern) after training
primary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
primary_outcome.description: We assessed psychological parameters of stress coping with the following questionnaire: AVEM ("Arbeitsbezogene Verhaltens- und Erlebensmuster"; Schaarschmidt & Fischer, 2008). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Alteration in physiological parameters of stress: HRV parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
primary_outcome.description: For the physiological assessment of HRV we used the HRV-Scanner from BioSign GmbH which gathers different HRV parameters like RMSSD and pNN50. HRV was assessed before and after a stressor (Stroop Color-Word Task (based on findings by Stroop, 1935) and D2-R Concentration and Endurance test (Brickenkamp et al., 2010). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Alteration in physiological parameters of stress: Salivary cortisol
primary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
primary_outcome.description: Cortisol was assessed as salivary cortisol (one sample per subject per assessment point). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of psychological wellbeing after training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
secondary_outcome.description: We assessed psychological wellbeing with the following questionnaire: HEALTH-49 ("Kurzversion der Hamburger Module zur Erfassung allgemeiner Aspekte psychosozialer Gesundheit f체r die therapeutische Praxis"; Rabung, Harfst, Koch & Schulz, 2007). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of depression after training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
secondary_outcome.description: We assessed depressive symptoms with the following questionnaire: Beck Depressions-Inventar (BDI-II; Hautzinger, Keller & K체hner; 2006). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of mindfulness after training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
secondary_outcome.description: We assessed mindfulness with the following questionnaire: FFA 14 ("Kurzversion des Freiburger Fragebogens zur Achtsamkeit"; Walach et al., 2006). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alteration in psychological parameters of self-compassion after training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: H0: Baseline time point of assessment prior to training H1: Post training time point of assessment (6 weeks after H0) H2: Follow-up (12 weeks after H0) H3: Post training time point of assessment for former wait-list control group (18 weeks after H0)
secondary_outcome.description: We assessed self-compassion with the following questionnaire: SCS-D-Kurzform ("Self-Compassion Scale"; Hupfeld & Ruffieux, 2011). Alteration in data will be statistically compared.

arm_group.description: Mindfulness based intervention, training about 30 minutes/day
Mindfulness based HRV biofeedback. Wait list control group for the interventions HRV-Bfb and MBI, after the main phase intervention with combined method.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults
- Working in the business in which the study is conducted
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac disease
- Thyroid disease (intake of glucocorticoids)
- Actual psychological illness
- Intake of psychotropic drugs
- Intake of other medication changing HRV
